tn.ref: So may the gods do to me, and more also
tn.text: This is a comparison used as an emphatic oath. "May the gods kill me and do even more bad things"

tn.ref: if I do not make your life like the life of one of those dead prophets
tn.text: "if I do not kill you like you killed those prophets"

tn.ref: he arose
tn.text: "he stood up"

tn.ref: he himself went a day's journey
tn.text: The word "himself" is used to emphasize that he was alone. AT: "he walked by himself for a day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])

tn.ref: broom tree
tn.text: A "broom tree" is a plant that grows in the desert. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: He requested for himself that he might die
tn.text: "He prayed that he would die"

tn.ref: It is enough, now, Yahweh
tn.text: "These troubles are too much for me, Yahweh"

tn.ref: bread that had been baked on coals
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "bread that someone had cooked on hot stones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: jug of water
tn.text: "a container of water"

tn.ref: will be too much for you
tn.text: "will be too difficult for you."

tn.ref: he traveled in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights
tn.text: "that food gave him energy to travel for 40 days and 40 nights" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: to a cave there
tn.text: Here the word "there" refers to Mount Horeb. A cave is an opening in a mountainside that leads to a natural room or rooms underground.

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came to him and said to him
tn.text: This idiom means Yahweh spoke and "word" is a metonymy representing the message. "Yahweh spoke his word and said to him." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:11|6:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: What are you doing here, Elijah?
tn.text: Yahweh asks this question to rebuke Elijah and to remind him of his duty. AT: "This is not where you should be, Elijah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I, only I, am left
tn.text: Here the word "I" is repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: on the mountain before me
tn.text: "Before me" is an idiom for standing in front of someone. AT: "on the mountain in my presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: he wrapped his face in his cloak
tn.text: "he covered his face with his cloak" A cloak is a long robe, a piece of clothing that covers the whole body.

tn.ref: Then a voice came to him
tn.text: "Then he heard a voice"

tn.ref: What are you doing here ... and they are also trying to take my life
tn.text: Translate this text as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:19:09|19:9-10]].

tn.ref: I, only I, am left
tn.text: Here the word "I" is repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: prophet in your place
tn.text: "prophet instead of you"

tn.ref: It will happen
tn.text: This phrase is used to introduce what will happen when Elijah does what Yahweh has told him to do. "What will happen is"

tn.ref: whoever escapes from the sword of Hazael
tn.text: "Sword" is metonymy for for killing as in battle. AT: "whomever Hazael does not kill with the sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will leave for myself
tn.text: Here the words "I" and "myself" refer to Yahweh. AT: "I will save from death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])

tn.ref: seven thousand people
tn.text: "7,000 people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: whose knees have not bent down to Baal, and whose mouths have not kissed him
tn.text: "Bending down" and "kissing" are metonymies for actions people did to worship idols. They are combined for emphasis. AT: "who have not bowed down and kissed Baal" or "who have not worshiped Baal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Shaphat
tn.text: This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: twelve yoke of oxen
tn.text: "12 yoke of oxen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: he himself was plowing with the twelfth yoke
tn.text: The word "himself" indicates that Elisha was plowing with the last yoke, while other men were plowing with the other eleven yokes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he said, "Please
tn.text: The word "he" refers to Elisha.

tn.ref: he gave it to the people
tn.text: Elisha gave the cooked meat to the people of his city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
